posts.post_content: Lifegain generally doesn't win games. That being said, at least this is aggressively costed lifegain - it's hard to find any card that will grant you 7 life for 2 mana at instant speed. Almost worth considering play in some sort of deck that would need lifegain; the problem there is that you're better off with Lifelink + dealing damage, which is easy to find in green and white.

Posted By: sonorhC (1/5/2013 3:21:32 PM)

posts.post_content: I loved playing Chalice of life, did a white metalcraft version. Then rotation started to get close, and I figured it was time to let it go until Orzhov came out. Then I realized they reprinted this. Let's see.... Turn 1 Cathedral Sanctifier turn 2 Heroes Reunion, +10 life in before you even drop the chalice. Add Nearheath Pilgrim, Rhox Faithmender, Elixer of Immortality and all kinds a good ways to pump your lifelinkers. This actually works. Definitely in kitchen table standard anyway. A fun deck that can surprise some people at events too.
posts.html:
